content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I used the "google" command to search for information on how to create a river. I used the "browse_website" command to visit the website "https://www.esri.com/arcgis-blog/products/arcgis-pro/mapping/make-a-river-map/" and find information on how to make a river map. I used the "get_hyperlinks" command to get all the hyperlinks from the same website.
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_python_code", "args": {"code": "import arcpy\\n\\n# Set the workspace\\narcpy.env.workspace = \\"C:/data\\"\\n\\n# Define the shapefile name and location\\nout_path = \\"C:/output\\"\\nout_name = \\"rivers.shp\\"\\n\\n# Create a new shapefile\\narcpy.CreateFeatureclass_management(out_path, out_name, \\"POLYLINE\\")\\n\\n# Add a field to the shapefile\\narcpy.AddField_management(out_name, \\"Name\\", \\"TEXT\\")\\n\\n# Create a cursor to insert new rows\\ncursor = arcpy.da.InsertCursor(out_name, [\\"SHAPE@\\", \\"Name\\"])\\n\\n# Create a polyline object for the river\\narray = arcpy.Array([arcpy.Point(0, 0), arcpy.Point(0, 10), arcpy.Point(10, 20), arcpy.Point(20, 30)])\\npolyline = arcpy.Polyline(array)\\n\\n# Insert the new row into the shapefile\\ncursor.insertRow([polyline, \\"River\\"])\\n\\n# Delete the cursor\\ndel cursor", "basename": "generate_river_map"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command execute_python_code returned: Error: Traceback (most recent call last):\n  File "/home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace/Atlas/executed_code/generate_river_map.py", line 1, in <module>\n    import arcpy\nModuleNotFoundError: No module named \'arcpy\'\n', type='action_result')]
"""
